intro: Pedicularis roylei subsp. roylei, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers that resemble small lice, hence its common name. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and opposite leaves, with flowers that are often clustered in racemes.
